page.title: 12THE TANNERY, KINGHORN (2)
page.content: Since, of course, animal hides will begin to decay, it is essential that they are processed fairly quickly after reaching the factory. Various fungal diseases, eg.,hair slip, can ruin a batch of hides. The sheepskins are converted into pickled pelts prior to sale. This involves liming to remove the wool, de-liming and treatment with ammonium sulphate to soften the skin, and pickling in salt, sulphuric acid and an anti-mould for long term protection. The wool removed is also graded and sold. Cow hides are treated in a similar manner before being sold to the finishing tanner for the manufacture of various grades of leather. Lastly, the factory is also involved in fat melting to produce high quality dripping.
